text: The play was no more than a figment of the imagination which asked the viewer to believe in a beautiful ghost. It would have been an impossible piece of television but for clever production by Michael Hayes. He captured the atmosphere of fog and that an American film, "Britain - Blood, Sweat, and Tears... Plus Twenty Years, was anti-British.
